description: Construction of a split level (two storey) dwellinghouse (1x2 bedroom) with associated landscaping and one car and cycle parking space
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: A GA (00) 02 Site Plan/Block Plan, A GA(10) 01 Rev. B Proposed Floorplans,  A GA (11) 01 Rev. A  Proposed Elevation 01, A GA (11) 02 Rev. A Proposed Elevation 02, A GA 911) 03 Rev. A Proposed Elevation 03 , A GA (11) 04 Rev. A proposed Elevation 04 and A GA 912) 01 Rev. A Proposed Section
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Samples of the materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

REASON: To ensure that the development harmonises with the character and appearance of the dwelling and would preserve the character and appearance of the St. Stephen's Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2016.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016.

| Provision for cycle storage, as per approved plan no. A GA (10) 01 Rev. B shall be provided prior to occupation of the unit and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016.
| No part of the roof of the ground floor section of the dwelling shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7A, Local Variation 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1(g), 2.1 (a) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016.

| Refuse and recycling storage, as per approved plan, no. A GA (10)01 Rev B, shall be provided prior to the occupation of the unit and these facilities shall thereafter be and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016.

| No operations (including initial site clearance) shall commence on site in connection with development hereby approved until a suitable scheme (Arboricultural Method Statement) for the protection of existing trees has been submitted to and its installation on site has been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

All protection measures must fully detail each phase of the development process taking into account demolition/site clearance works, all construction works and hard and soft landscaping works.  Details shall include the following:

o	Full survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837*, with tree works proposals.  All trees must be plotted on a site plan**, clearly and accurately depicting trunk 	locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads.
o	A plan** detailing all trees, shrubs, hedges planned for retention and removal.
o	Soil assessments/survey
o	Timing and phasing of works
o	Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications
o	Site specific construction specifications
o	Access arrangements and car parking
o	Level changes
o	Landscaping proposals

o	A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.
o	Soil remediation plans.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.
*Using the most recent revision the of the Standard
** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority)

Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policy 5.10 of the Adopted Development Management Plan and 7.21 of the London Plan 2016.

| Prior to the commencement of works (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works), the following detailed information shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval:

a) An intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site, carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance, to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person and shall assess any contamination on the site.

b) A contamination remediation scheme to bring the relevant parts of the site to a condition suitable for the intended end use. The scope of the remediation scheme shall include details of all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, a timetable of works and site management procedures. The remediation scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.

Within six-months of the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme, a verification report (in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1') that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

Reason: Further investigations of the presence of soil contamination within the application site and details of the methods for remediation are required before the commencement of building works in order to ensure that human health and the environment are protected, and to ensure the development activities do not activate or spread contamination in accordance with policies LV5.21 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), Policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2016, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
